Clip.Title: MAKING MAO
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Making Mao revisits the people and events responsible for making Mao Zedong the star of this Communist propaganda cultural phenomenon.

Clip.Title: LINCOLN'S WASHINGTON AT WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Washington, D.C. in 1861. The Civil War is at the doorstep and the city is bracing for disaster. America is a country torn in two. An untested President Lincoln strives to make the nation's capital the political center of the Union, but finds he is surrounded by Southern sympathies and under constant threat of attack.

Clip.Title: ASIA'S MONARCHIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Journey to the heart of these beautiful lands to understand the relationship between the people and their monarchs.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Half Cherokee and half Scottish, John Norton leads Six Nations warriors against the invading Americans.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An east coast shipper creates a private naval fleet to seize American ships.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Bella Coola to Prince Rupert, this aerial journey encounters some of British Columbia's most remote settlements and stunning, inland mountain ranges.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey of world famous Cape Breton Island reveals why this has been called the "world's greatest road trip" - from the Canso Causeway to the Cape Breton Highlands - the island is a world unto its own.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: DESIGN BY DECADE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Dynamic. Original. Audacious. These are just some of the words that describe Canadian design during the 1980's. As Postmodernism infiltrated the design realm, objects became more decorative and often more daring.

Clip.Title: CITY GUIDES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow our City Guide as she takes us around the largest preserved Victorian neighbourhood in North America.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.Title: TULLA, THE SINGING WELL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the Horn of Africa, when the drought comes each year, the Borana herders gather with their livestock around their wells, singing work songs that create a working rhythm. See their unique water management system through the season.

Clip.Title: WATER HEROES: AN INDIAN WATER STORY
Clip.Episode: WATER HEROES: AN INDIAN WATER STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: India suffers a great water crisis in many of its regions. See how two water crusaders have made significant difference in the lives of the villagers in these regions by their simple water conservation techniques.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
